response_parsed.title: Harden Edge Runtimes Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to improve the security and performance of your FastAPI applications when deployed as edge runtimes on Python 3.12+. It covers key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: Leverage security best practices like input validation, content security policy (CSP), and rate limiting
Implement environment variables for configuration to avoid hardcoding sensitive data
Use FastAPI features like OpenAPI documentation and HTTP routing to simplify API development
Employ asynchronous processing for improved performance with Python 3.12+
Optimize error handling and logging for debugging and monitoring

    async def get_current_user(token: str = Depends(oauth2_scheme.verify_and_decode)):

    @app.post('/login', response_model=None)
    async def login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends()):
        user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password)
        access_token_expires = timedelta(minutes=30)
        access_token = create_access_token(data={'sub': user.id}, expires_delta=access_token_expires)
